Title: üñº The Kremlin media spread a fake that Zelensky bought Hitler‚Äôs ...
Description: The Kremlin media spread a fake that Zelensky bought Hitler‚Äôs residence. The source of this information was the TG channel of an employee of the pro-Kremlin MIA -Russia Today-, member of the public chamber Armen Gasparyan, writes The Insider. In the publication, Gasparyan refers to a certain German publication Aktuelle Nachrichten in Deutschland (-Current news in Germany-).The Internet Archive first discovered this media on December 14, 2024, before which there were no signs of its existence. -Apparently, this is another fake publication created by Russian propagandists to spread disinformation,- writes The Insider. Journalists also studied the -purchase and sale agreement- published by Aktuelle Nachrichten in Deutschland. The document was signed by an official from another administrative district, and for some reason the name and position of the person who signed the document is hidden. In addition, the information that the residence will be closed to tourists also turned out to be false: the attraction was closed for the winter, opening is expected on May 9, 2025.Gazeta.ru later deleted the fake.

This is stated in the Conflict Intelligence Team report, based on data from official departments, media reports and information from open sources.In the Kyiv-controlled territories of Ukraine, 1915 people died, including 81 children. 10,164 people were injured. Description: A special contract will be introduced in Ukraine for Ukrainians aged 18-24 who want to serve in the army - ZelenskyIn interview Reuters The President of Ukraine said that Ukraine is developing a contract option for young people aged 18 to 24 who would like to serve in the army. Title: üñº Z-channels accuse the command of the Russian Armed Forces of f...
Description: Z-channels accuse the command of the Russian Armed Forces of false reports about the situation in the Kursk directionOn February 6, 2025, Ukrainian troops carried out In the Kursk direction, the second attack in the last month in order to expand the bridgehead and move the front away from Sudzha. On the same day, the Russian Ministry of Defense reported that the Ukrainian Armed Forces launched eight waves attacks. -With the support of aviation and artillery, the Ukrainian assault units were stopped and defeated,- the report says. However, on February 7, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) and Z-channels reported that in days the Ukrainian Armed Forces advanced 5 kilometers southeast of Suji. Z-volunteer Roman Alekhin wrote a post in which he stated that the command of the Russian Armed Forces is hiding the truth and sending soldiers into battle without proper training, increasing losses: -It is the command of the Russian Armed Forces in the direction that is to blame for the fact that yesterday the enemy improved its position in the Kursk region. And it may very well be that today he will continue to improve his position, and the command, in order to hide another lie of recent months, will again begin to drive soldiers without training, increasing losses.-Alekhine especially harshly criticizes General Sukhrab Akhmedov, whose departure from the 20th Army, according to the author, became a real holiday for everyone. He notes that his mistakes, like the mistakes of other generals, continue to cost dearly on the battlefield.Previously, Z-channels accused General Akhmedov of giving away in June 2023 orderto line up Russian military personnel in the Kremennaya area, preparing them for action - as a result, the Ukrainian Armed Forces struck a military concentration with a HIMARS missile. The Marines of the 155th Brigade also mentioned Akhmedov in their complaint to the governor of Primorsky Krai, in which they expressed dissatisfaction with the command and huge losses near Pavlovka in Donetsk region.In December 2023, Putin signed a decree awarding Akhmedov the rank of lieutenant general.

Description: ASTRA: The first female defendant in the -Baymak case- was sentenced. The Industrial District Court of Samara found 29-year-old Minziya Adigamova guilty of participating in mass riots (this is how the protest events in Baymak in January 2024 are interpreted) and using violence against a representative... Vilyura Karachurin and Aitugan Malabaev were sentenced to 5 years each, the rest of the defendants were given 4.5 years in prison.The -Baymak case- is a criminal trial against protest participants in Bashkortostan. In January 2024, the most massive protests in Russia in recent years took place in Bashkortostan. The reason for the actions was the trial of local activist Fail Alsynov. Residents of Baymak, dissatisfied with his persecution, took to the streets several times. Then protests spread to Ufa. The brutal dispersal of the protesters was followed by a series of criminal cases against the protesters. The -Baymak case- is considered the largest since the times of the USSR.

Title: üñº A new regime for the expulsion of illegal migrants has begun t...
Description: A new regime for the expulsion of illegal migrants has come into effect in Russia On February 5, the regime for expulsion for foreigners illegally staying in the country came into force in Russia. They will be entered into the register of controlled persons, which involves a number of restrictions and prohibitions before subsequent deportation. The register is posted on the official website of the Ministry of Internal Affairs and is available in the public domain. A foreigner is considered to be notified of inclusion in the list from the moment the data is published. Persons included in the register will not be able to change their place of residence without permission from the Ministry of Internal Affairs, travel outside the region, drive vehicles, purchase property, register real estate in the cadastral register, open bank accounts and make financial transactions. In addition, such migrants are required to appear at the Ministry of Internal Affairs upon request. In the event of a double violation of the established restrictions, they are deported and placed in a special institution of the department. Also, from February 5, employees of the Ministry of Internal Affairs received the right to independently expel foreign citizens from the country for violations provided for by the Code of Administrative Offences. These powers were given to the heads of territorial police bodies and their deputies, as well as the heads of departments for migration and drug control. The decision on deportation for violating the rules of stay can now be made by the heads of the transport police.

Description: -The doctors said: it‚Äôs okay, he won‚Äôt die-: high school student Yegor Balazeikin, convicted of setting fire to military registration and enlistment offices, was denied sick leave in the colony, despite his deteriorating condition and disability 18-year-old political prisoner Yegor Balazeikin continues to suffer from deteriorating health in the colony. On February 1, during a long visit with his parents, his body reacted strongly to regular food, which differed from the prison diet. According to activists, for three days after the meeting, Yegor could not get out of bed and was in such bad condition that he could barely stand on his feet. On February 3, the support group reported that Yegor was denied sick leave, despite his deteriorating health. He did not receive the necessary tests that should have been done in December, and problems with his spine reappeared. -Egor went to the doctor, but they refused to give him sick leave, they said that it was okay, that he wouldn‚Äôt die. They gave him some strange pills, and the antibiotic turned out to be not for him, but for another prisoner. For three days he ate practically nothing, drinking only tea. When I returned to the detachment, my condition did not improve. Since it was Saturday, and doctors don‚Äôt work on weekends, he was given activated charcoal and the drugs that I brought for the date. Yesterday, he said, it got even worse, he started vomiting, and his stomach hurt a lot. He went to see a doctor again, but there was no improvement, he was not given sick leave,- Tatyana, the political prisoner‚Äôs mother, told ASTRA. She added that she was worried, not understanding the exact reason for the deterioration of her son‚Äôs condition. -We brought medicine with us, but it is still unclear how to treat him. Maybe it was an intestinal infection or a virus, or maybe just indigestion from the fact that his body was not used to normal food after prison food. He never received the necessary tests, and I don‚Äôt know what to tell him for the next date,- she said, emphasizing that without tests it is impossible to determine the correct treatment. According to the latest reports from the support group, Yegor's condition is still improving. -Egor felt better. I started eating a little. The abdominal pain goes away, the vomiting has stopped,-‚Äî representatives of the group wrote in their Telegram channel.In November 2023, the court sentenced Balazeikin to six years in prison in the case of throwing a Molotov cocktail at the St. Petersburg military registration and enlistment office. Memorial recognized him as a political prisoner. During the trial, he admitted the fact of arson, but stated that he did not intend to intimidate people or cause damage. After reaching adulthood, Yegor was transferred to an adult colony, despite his health condition. In May 2024, he was included in the list of terrorists and extremists, and the Memorial Project recognized him as a political prisoner.
